Class FileReadWrite

java.lang.Object
FileReadWrite
public class FileReadWrite extends Object
A class that handles the reading and writing of text files such as the dictionary file and the tester file.

    • CheckDuplicates

      public boolean CheckDuplicates(String input, String filePath)
      A method to compare an input to the dictionary and compare it to the current entries in the text file.
      Parameters:
      input - The input to be added to the text file, so it can be checked against current entries to the text file.
      filePath - Defines the path of the targeted text file.
      Returns:
      boolean returns the value of whether the text input is a duplicate or not.

    • FileWrite

      public void FileWrite(String input, int selection)
      Method that writes to the text file.
      Parameters:
      input - The input to be added to the text file.
      selection - Defines the path of the targeted text file.

      public ArrayList<String> FileToArray(String filePath)
      Method to convert a text file of entries into an array.
      Parameters:
      filePath - Defines the path of the targeted text file.
      Returns:
      ArrayList This is returning the array of the values included in the text files.
